IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To enhance the educational experience of every Pike student by providing resources for innovative, high quality approaches to education.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To enhance the educational experience of every Pike student by providing resources for innovative, high quality approaches to education.
IRS990.Desc: Fund scholarships for eligible Pike High School students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Fund grants for new program opportunities in the Pike Township schools.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All scholarships are chosen according to the criteria provided for each scholarship. See website for more information. A summary of most scholarships follow:Alumni Scholarships: Selected by committee of PHS Alumni.Richard H. Crosser Memorial Scholarship: Awarded to a student who intends to pursue fields related to building trades and best meetscriteria established by Foundation.Michael K. Guest Memorial Scholarship: Established by Pike alumnus, parent and community member, this is awarded to a student with min 3.5 GPA, active in community, & high character.Hallmark of Excellence Scholarship: Awarded to a senior student who ranks in the upper 10% of their graduating class.Maggie Harry Memorial Scholarship: Honoring a PHS student who lost her life to bi-polar disease, awarded to a PHS student who has made concentrated efforts to improve quality of life.Pike Prep Academy Scholarships: Awarded to one or more students, as selected by PPA staff.Walter S. Moll Memorial Scholarship: Established by the Moll Family andEsco Communications as part of the Lilly Initiative Endowment BuildingCampaign, awarded to one senior high student who plans to pursue a 2 or 4 year degree in technical sciences. (None this fiscal year)Overcoming Obstacles Scholarship: Awarded to one has overcome a major hardship and min 2.5 GPA.Reaching for Success Scholarship: Awarded to students who pursue excellence, but not in top 10%, and who best meets criteria established by Foundation.Shukla Family Scholarship: A renewable four year scholarship awarded to a deserving student who demonstrates financial need and best meets criteria established by the Foundation.Clarence C. Wood Scholarship: Awarded to a student who demonstrates value of community service and giving back to the Pike Community and other criteria established by Foundation.Stanford Keglar Achievement Scholarship: Awarded to a student who demonstrates active participation in their church, community, and school.Minority Women in STEM Scholarship: Awarded to a PHS minority woman who has demonstrated academic achievement in STEM.IB Scholarship: Awarded to one student in the IB Programme who best fits the IB Learner Profile as established by Foundation.Joel Leaman Memorial Scholarship: Established to honor this long-time coach and educator. Awarded to at least on PHS Senior in the top 10% of their class.Michael Thibault Culinary Arts Scholarship: Awarded to a student who plans to pursue a career in the culinary field.Moving Forward Scholarship: Awarded to up to 8 students pursuing a Core 40 distinction or higher by the Foundation.Plan to Succeed Scholarship: Awarded to a first-generation college student pursuing a Core 40 diploma or higher and have a GPA between 2.7 & 3.5.Gloria Jean Cobb Serving the World Scholarship: Awarded to a student who plans to pursue a two-year or four-year degree in a field related to public service while continuing a passion for serving the community.Ed & Carmen Siegel Scholarship: Honoring the former boys' basketball coach and board member,this scholarship is awarded to 1 student each year.Coach Darner Scholarship: Honoring former Head Coach Alan Darner of the Pike boys' basketball team. Awarded to 1 student each year.Voight Family Scholarship: Awarded to a student who is a first-generation college student and demonstrates a drive to make a positive impact in the world by furthering their education. (None this year)Honoring the Amazing Pike Educators Alumni Association Scholarship: Awarded to a student who best describes their favorite teacher in an essay.Taylor M Owens Scholarship: One-time award to a graduating senior who embodies hard work, integrity, reliability, kindness, and a drive to improve & succeed.Jodi MacDonald Memorial Scholarship: 4 year renewable scholarship awarded to a student who plays a sport, and is pursuing a degree in education.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Before filing, the 990 tax return is submitted to the Board of Directors for review in a regularly scheduled Board meeting. The treasurer is responsible for leading all inquiry and explanation related to the Form 990 along with the executive director.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board Members are required to review and sign the conflict of interest policy and disclose any conflicts on an annual basis or when a material change occurs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors conduct an annual performance and salary review of the Executive Director. The Boards recommendations will be communicated to the Executive Director by the Board President.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing Documents are available to the public through the PTEF Forum or upon request.
